settings.lockGroupDesc: A concurrency group can be any string or expression, and the effective scope is under the current project. Support variables with values that can be determined during the startup phase, such as ${{ci.pipeline_id}}、${{ci.branch}}、${{variables.a}} (provided that the value of a is clear at startup), etc

settings.executorTips: (execute, list, share artifact, download artifact, view)
settings.addition: Why there are additional people or groups
settings.addtionDesc: Additional people or groups refer to those who have the access to any pipelines under your project and are authorized by admin. If you want to get them removed, please contact your admin

settings.additionUserPlaceholder: Support environment variables (${var}), multiple environment variables are separated by commas

settings.groupIdDesc: Capable of sending notifications to groups on WeCom. How to obtain group ID: add 'DevOpsRobot' into the group, @ it and send '群ID', then you will get the group ID.
settings.wechatGroupMarkdownFlag: Show WeCom group message with Markdown format
settings.cleanTips: The loading speeding on CI will be greatly increased if the pipeline builds can be sorted out regularly. Please apply a reasonable clearing strategy.
settings.maxConRunningQueueSizeTips: The range of maximum concurrency is between 1 and 200-200之间

history.uploadLog: The log is uploading, please try again later
history.noPackages: No artifacts found in this period
history.fiterPackageTips: Filtered by file names; press Enter to search
history.creator: Creator
history.noPermissionTips: You don't have permission to view this pipeline. Please switch to another project or apply for permission
history.noEditPermissionTips: You don't have permission to edit this pipeline. Please switch to another project or apply for permission
history.noReleaseBuildEmptyTips: The pipeline has not been published yet. Please publish it first and then start execution. Once the pipeline is released, the execution of the build task can be triggered. Each build will be assigned a unique ID and all build records will be displayed here.
history.buildEmptyDesc: After defining the pipeline, you can manually trigger a build. A one and only ID will be assigned to each build and records of builds are shown here
history.reBuildTips1: When rebuilding, it will be re-executed with the same trigger parameters, and:
history.reBuildTips3: - The pipeline version used is based on the initial trigger
history.rePlayTips1: After replaying, a new build will be initiated with the same trigger parameters:
history.rePlayTips2: - A new BK_CI_BUILD_ID will be generated
history.rePlayTips3: - The latest pipeline version will be used to run
history.reBuildConfirmTips: Are you sure you want to initiate a rebuild?
history.rePlayConfirmTips: Are you sure you want to replay the event for this pipeline?
history.rePlayInfo1: 1. When replaying, start a new Play with the same trigger parameters and the latest pipeline version.
history.rePlayInfo2: 2. When replaying, skip trigger detection, and it may not meet the trigger conditions of the latest version.
history.reBuildInfo1: 1. Rebuilding is to re-execute on the basis of the previous build.
history.reBuildInfo2: 2. Pipeline version, BK_CI_BUILD_ID are consistent with those when it is triggered for the first time.

preview.skipTipsPrefix: If your pipeline has been successfully debugged, you can prevent the selection of certain plugins to run in the
preview.versionSelectorDisableTips:
1. When a PAC branch version exists, you can choose to execute the branch version.
2. When there is no PAC branch version, the latest current version will always be executed.

editPage.envProjectTips: The default is the current project. Fill in the English name of the corresponding project
editPage.envProjectPlaceholder: The default is the current project
editPage.tipError: Tip component return value needs to be a string
editPage.atomPropChangedTip: The current version has added new parameters or changed parameter types, please carefully confirm whether the corresponding settings of the parameters meet expectations (the changed fields have been highlighted)!
editPage.manualReviewNameSpaceTip: The user who actually performed the review
editPage.thirdImageHolder: Please enter the full image path, such as xxx.xxx.com/your-namespace/your-imagename:1.0
editPage.notWorkAtCur: Not available under current Job type
editPage.noInstallRight: No permission to install this image
editPage.unRecomReason: The docker image is no longer recommended and will be removed later. Such docker images are generally provided with a replacement docker image, please use the new image
editPage.selectJob: Please select the type of job
editPage.stageManualTriggerUserNoEmptyTips: Please add at least one approval step
editPage.triggerTooltips: Click builds to trigger the configurable recommended version and pipeline variables
editPage.abort: Reject, and set current task status failed
editPage.thirdSlaveTips: If there are several Agents under the pools, assign the ones used last time; if the agents have not been used before, then assign randomly
editPage.workspaceTips: If not filled, the it will be saved in [Agent installation directory]/workspace/[pipeline ID]/src by default
editPage.envDependencyTips: Not recommended. Given software might not be compatible with your desired build environment. It is recommended to create and use your docker image instead. After selecting the dependence on tools above, the following will be executed:
editPage.locksSlaveTips: Once set, with this configuration, Jobs that are similar (including those with locked resources) must all finish execution before the build resources are released.
editPage.customTriggerControlTips: After meeting the basic filter conditions, judge whether it can be triggered according to the return of the third-party interface
editPage.paramsTips: Variables can be referenced in the plugin using the expression ${{ xxx }}.
editPage.descTips: Enter a description of parameters, it will display in preview page
editPage.showOnStarting: Value can be set when manually starting the run
editPage.defaultValueDesc:
If value is the version number, then it should not contain symbols, such as "" ; 
 if the type of parameters can be selected in the check box, when selecting serval values, they will be sent to pipelines in a (a,b) way.
editPage.batchAddTips:
● Multiple options are separated by newlines
 ● Each option cannot contain English commas
 ● Only one duplicate option will be displayed
 ● Similar to the HTML select tag, options support two formats: value=name / value
editPage.optionsDesc:
Separate options with line breaks
There should not be an English comma contained in the options
Only one option will be shown if there are serval same options at the same time
Similar to the HTML SELECT tag,format "{value}={name} | {value} "
editPage.optionTips: Please break your lines if there are serval things to be recorded
editPage.relativePathTips: Please fill in relative path to code repository. If left empty, the subdirectory under the root path of code repository will be pulled out.
editPage.codelibParams: Please select the type of code repository
editPage.buildResType: Please select the type of build resources
editPage.filterRuleTips: Support * (wildcard character) if left empty, then the file path can't be matched
editPage.paramsDesc: Please enter a description of parameters
editPage.introVersionTips: You can use this variable from plugins to set version number or apply it to other places that require the presence of it
editPage.noPermToInstall: No permission to install this plugin
editPage.notIntroduceReason: This plugin is no longer recommended to use and will be withdrawn due to its design flaw or the change in the way of implementing it. There is usually a substitute for it, so please use the new one
editPage.envUseTips: {0} Usable under compiling environment, please switch to the corresponding type of job and then try again
editPage.noEnvUseTips: This plugin is usable within agentless job, please switch to the corresponding type of job and then try again
editPage.badLink: The format of this link is incorrect
editPage.repoConflict: , several codes in the current pipeline are pulling the same plugin, you need to set this field to settle this clash
editPage.svnVersionTips: SVN pulls the version number specified by code plugins
editPage.certInstallTips: The third-party building machine doesn't support the plugin of installing IOS certificate at the moment
editPage.stepIdPlaceholder: Must be unique in this job
editPage.stepIdDesc: Only begin with letters or underscores, and only contain letters, numbers, and underscores
editPage.noAppIdTips: The plugin you are using requires the service provided by Blue Whale. Please contact DevOps (customer service from Blue Shield) to enable it.
editPage.cronWeekHint: Please tick the weekly trigger time
editPage.crontabExpression: Please fill in the correct crontab expression and break them if there are many
editPage.triggerEmptyTips: Basic rule and custom expression can't be left empty at the same time
editPage.noScm: Don‘t trigger it when the source code has not been updated
editPage.atomVersionDesc:
Major version number.latest: means to use the latest plugins under the 
 corresponding major version number
editPage.selectAtomVersion: Please select your preferred version of plugins
editPage.noAtomVersion: No usable version for the current plugin maybe because the release of it has been cancelled or it is being released
editPage.commitIdTips: Please enter the assigned commit ID
editPage.githubAppTips: Need to install xxx before enabling this plugin
editPage.paramEmptyTips: No parameters exist in this sub-pipeline
editPage.remoteCurlTips: After this plugin is added, the current pipeline can be triggered for building through specific URL ( the person who activate it is the one who last edited the pipeline, the trigger person can be passed in via X-DEVOPS-UID )
editPage.confirmMsg: Please save the pipeline before exiting, otherwise all changes will be lost.
editPage.closeConfirmMsg: Please save the data before closing, otherwise all changes will be lost.
editPage.publicResTips: The build cluster provided by Blue Shield saves you from worrying the short supply of resources and security issue

atomForm.customPathTips: The relative path to custom repository; support * (wildcard character)

atomForm.noHyAppidTips: The plugin you are using has not been linked to mixed Cloud business. Please contact DevOps (customer service from Blue Shield) if needed.

atomForm.emptyTclsId: Please fill in the correct tcls ID

atomForm.createTurbo: No task of speeding up compiling at the moment. Click to add a new task

editPage.timerTriggerCodelibTips:
- Git repository: Branch is optional, defaults to the default branch when not specified.
-SVN repository: Branch is mandatory, must be a first-level subdirectory under the repository root path.
editPage.timerTriggerBranchTips: If multiple branches have changes, each branch will trigger once when conditions are met.
editPage.filePathTips: Please enter the directory where the file is stored, e.g., /a
editPage.fileNameTips: File name, leave blank to auto-detect
editPage.enableDocker: Enable Docker for Running Build Tasks
editPage.ifNotPresent: Pull only if not present locally
editPage.enableDockerTips: When using this feature, please ensure that the build machine has Docker installed, and that the user running the third-party build agent has the necessary permissions to operate Docker.
editPage.lineBreak: Separate multiple options with line breaks
editPage.noEnglishCommas: Each option cannot contain English commas
editPage.formatSupport: Similar to the HTML select tag, options support value=name / value formats
editPage.versionControlTip: Once enabled, uploading files will automatically generate versioned paths within the directory to prevent overwriting files with the same name.

storeMap.pauseNotifyTip: When suspended before execution, an enterprise WeChat message will be sent to the designated user to notify the user to process it as soon as possible. The default is the pipeline executor
storeMap.runManual: You can manually decide to continue running or stop, and you can modify the parameters when you continue
storeMap.jobLimit: 单个stage下的job数量不能大于
storeMap.atomLimit: 单个job下的插件数量不能大于
storeMap.oneCodecc: Only one codecc plugin is allowed added to pipeline
storeMap.oneManualTrigger: Only one manually-triggered plugin can exist in pipeline
storeMap.oneTimerTrigger: Only one timer-triggered plugin can exist in pipeline
storeMap.oneRemoteTrigger: Only one remotely-triggered plugin triggered can exist in pipeline
storeMap.continueWhenFailedDesc: If you open the option 'Continue on error' at the same time, we will continue only when all retry failed
storeMap.timeoutDesc: Positive integer between 1-10080, support for referencing pipeline variables
storeMap.prepareTimeoutDesc: Timeout for queued waiting when the node is busy. Default 10 minutes
storeMap.timeoutPlaceholder: Positive integer between 1-10080, support for referencing pipeline variables
storeMap.atomPreSuc: Run when all pre-plugins run successfully (including continue when failed)
storeMap.atomEvenFail: Even if a previous task has failed, unless the build was canceled
storeMap.userCancelExec: The plugin is executing, but the user canceled it manually or has timed out
storeMap.atomEvenCancel: Run even if a previous plugin failed, and run even if it was cancelled
storeMap.atomOnlyFail: Only when a previous task has failed
storeMap.varMatch: Run when all custom variables are matched
storeMap.varNotMatch: Don't run it when all the custom variables are matched
storeMap.customCondition: Run when custom expression is satisfied
storeMap.preStageSuccess: Run it when previous stage has succeed
storeMap.preStageFail: Run it when previous stage has failed
storeMap.preStageCancel: Run it when previous stage has been canceled
storeMap.dependOnDesc: Please select or input the Job ID you depend on, split By English comma when using input
storeMap.stageRunning: Run when current stage is started
storeMap.strategyDesc:
Declare the parameter combination, each parameter combination will trigger a job when executed. The value format is object<string, list>, YAML syntax. Demo：
cpu: [ amd64 ]
microservice: [webhook, apiserver]
storeMap.includeCaseDesc: You can add parameter combinations on the basis of the parameter matrix, or add additional attributes to a group of parameters. The value format is list<object>, YAML syntax.
storeMap.excludeCaseDesc: One or more combinations defined in the parameter matrix can be excluded. The value format is list<object>, YAML syntax.
storeMap.mutualGroupNamePlaceholder: The field must be filled and only supports English letter, numbers or variables
storeMap.queueEnable: Enable the queue of mutually exclusive groups
storeMap.mutualTimeoutPlaceholder: Positive integer between 1-10080, support for referencing pipeline variables
storeMap.queuePlaceholder: Please fill in an integer between 1 and 50
storeMap.singleNodeConcurrencyPlaceholder: Default is the maximum concurrency set on the node
storeMap.allNodeConcurrencyPlaceholder: The theoretical concurrency = concurrency per node * number of nodes

pipelineParam.useTips: Can be referenced through the expression ${{ variables.<var_name> }}
pipelineParam.buildParamTips: Set as input variable, allow change startup value in scenarios like manual, remote, openapi, or sub-pipeline triggers
pipelineParam.readOnlyTips: During the pipeline running, value cannot be reset through methods like ::set-variable
pipelineParam.dataPathTips: Defaults to data if not specified, for example: data.detail.list
pipelineParam.paramIdTips: When selected, this ID value is passed to the plugin
pipelineParam.paramNameTips: Option name as seen by the user on the page

newui.sysVarTips: Can be referenced through the expression ${{ ci.<var_name> }}
newui.atomVarTips: Can be referenced through the expression ${{ steps.<StepID>.outputs.<var_name> }}
newui.stepUseWarn: Cannot use variables outputted by current step or downstream steps

permissionRefreshtitle: Permission Request form has been submitted
permissionRefreshSubtitle: Please fill in the permission request form in the permission center and refresh the page after submission

deleteGroupTips: The pipelines in the group are not deleted
patchAddToGroupTitle: Add {0} pipelines to the selected pipeline group below
removeConfirmTips: Confirm to move the following pipeline out of {0}?
deleteTips: After pipeline is deleted, it can be retrieved in the Recycle
deletePipelineConfirm: Confirm to delete the following pipeline?
deleteTheNumberOfPipelineConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the following {0} pipelines?
deletePipelineConfirmDesc: After pipeline is deleted, it can be retrieved in the recycle bin
patchSearchInputPlaceholder: Pipeline Name / Creator / Pipeline Group Name/ Label
labelGroupNameErr: Failed to save Label group name
labelGroupDeleteConfirm: Confirm to delete this label group
saveBeforePreviewTips: After modifying the conditions, please click 'Preview' to confirm, and then save
staticGroupPlaceholder: Automatic matching will be done based on the label of the pipeline
pipelineGroupRepeatTips: {0} already exists, please change the name
dynamicGroupRemoveDisableTips: Dynamic groups cannot be manually moved out of the pipeline
hasNoPermissionPipelineTips: There are {0} pipelines without permission to delete, and {1} PAC pipelines default branch cannot be deleted in YAML
dynamicGroupTips: Dynamic matching based on the name, tag and other attributes
projectedGroupDisableTips: Only project administrators can create pipeline groups that are visible to the project
groupEditDisableTips: Only administrators can add or remove pipelines to or from project pipeline groups
pacGroupDisableTips: Automatically created by enabling PAC mode, not support manually add/remove pipeline
removedPipelineError: Failure to move out of the line
groupNameTooLong: Pipeline group names cannot exceed 32 characters in length
groupNameNotAllowEmpty: The pipeline group name cannot be empty
pipelineLockTips: The pipeline has been disabled. It cannot be triggered in any way
pipelineManualDisable: This pipeline is not configured for manual trigger
applySuccess: Application succeeded, please wait for approval
fillReason: Please fill in the application reason
namespaceTips: Deprecated. Please use Step ID to set the namespace of plugin fields and access them through
outputNameSpaceDescTips:
It is used to solve the problem of output field conflicts when there are multiple instances of the same plugin under the pipeline. 
No need to add namespace when there is no conflict. 
When the namespace is modified, the subsequent use of the corresponding field also needs to be modified synchronously
skipSuc: Skipped the failed step and continued running
pacEnableTips: Pipeline has been enabled PAC mode, and pipeline configuration can be managed through code repository.
disablePipelineConfirmTips: Are you sure to disable this pipeline?
disablePacPipelineConfirmDesc: PAC mode pipeline, please add disable configuration in yaml file:
disablePipelineConfirmDesc: After disabling, the pipeline cannot be triggered in any way
enablePipelineConfirmTips: Are you sure to enable this pipeline?
enablePacPipelineConfirmDesc: PAC mode pipeline, please modify the disable setting in the default branch YAML to false, or remove the disable setting
enablePipelineConfirmDesc: Enable the pipeline, and it will run when the trigger conditions are met.
noDebugRecords: There is no debugging record yet. It may be that there is no draft at the moment or the current draft has not been debugged.
onlyDraftBuildHistoryTips: Pipeline has not been released, please release it first and then start execution.
onlyDraftBuildHistoryIdTips: Release the pipeline to trigger the build task
noBuildHistoryTips: Define the pipeline and then manually trigger the build task.
buildHistoryIdTips: System will assign a unique ID for each build, and all build records will be displayed here.
createPipelineSuc: Pipeline created successfully, you can continue to edit the draft or publish.
startTimeRangePlaceholder: Please select a start time range
deleteVersionConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the pipeline version【{0}】?
hasDraftTips: There is a draft being edited (based on {0})
dropDraftTips: Are you sure you want to abandon the current draft and create a new version based on {0}?
createDraftTips: Are you sure you want to create a new version based on the historical version {0}?
createBranchDraftTips: Are you sure you want to create a new version based on the branch {0}?
refVersionTips: This variable can be referenced in the plugin, used to set the version number or other places where this variable is needed
refParamsTips: Variables can be referenced in the plugin through the expression ${{ xxx }}
debugParamsTips: During debugging, the parameter values used in the last debugging will be automatically filled in for you. You can choose to restore to the default values
restoreDetaulParamsTips: The last build parameter value has been automatically filled in. If you don't need to fill it in, please modify the trigger [manual trigger] plugin configuration
paramChangeTips: The last build parameter value has been automatically filled in. {0} parameters have changed the default value. Please pay attention to whether the changes meet the expected
releaseTips0: 1. The current version has been transformed from a draft to an official version
releaseTips1: 2. When the trigger conditions are met, execution will be triggered
pacMRRelaseTips: Merge Request created and completed, please handle it at the code library...
pacMRRelaseSuc: Version not released successfully, please go to the code repository for handling merge request.
pacPipelineConfRule: YAML File Configuration Rules under PAC Mode
pacPipelineReleaseTips0: 1. In PAC mode, the YAML file is merged into the default branch, which is considered as the release of the official version
pacPipelineReleaseTips1: 2. YAML file selection rules under PAC mode
pacPipelineReleaseTips1-0: Triggered by Push/Tag event, the YAML file on the trigger branch/Tag shall prevail
pacPipelineReleaseTips1-1: Triggered by MR, the latest YAML on the source and target branches shall prevail. When the source and target both modify the YAML file, the changes on the target branch need to be synchronized to the source branch first, otherwise the trigger will fail
pacPipelineReleaseTips1-2: Triggered by other methods, such as timing, manual, issue, etc., the YAML file on the default branch shall prevail
leaveConfirmTitle: Are you sure you want to leave the current page?
leaveConfirmTips: Leaving will lose unsaved information, it is recommended to save before leaving
commitMsgDesc: Will be submitted to the code repository as a commit message
CHECKOUT_BRANCH_AND_REQUEST_MERGE: Add New Branch and Create MR to Default Branch
COMMIT_TO_SOURCE_BRANCH_AND_REQUEST_MERG: Commit to Source Branch {0} and Create MR
yamlCodeLibDesc: If the target repository cannot be found, please associate the repository under the code repository service and enable PAC mode first
noPacEnableCodelibYet: No code repository has enabled PAC mode yet
goCodelibsEnablePac: Go to Code Repository to Enable PAC Mode
oauthPacTips:
Not yet authorized, please click the button to authorize first.
After authorization, your identity will be used to submit the YAML file to the code repository. You need to have developer or higher permissions in the code repository.
withoutOauthCodelib: The code library source supported by the current environment has not yet been connected to the PAC function, please consult us
draftInfoTips: The current draft has not been published, last saved: {0} {1}
noReleaseYetTips: The pipeline has not been published yet, please publish before executing
draftPipelineExecTips: The pipeline has not been published yet, please publish before executing
scanQRCodeView:
Use Blue Shield APP
Scan the QR code to view the component list
needSignTips: {0} is an internal test version, downloading in progress, please wait
apkSignDurationTips: Only the first download requires waiting. Preparation time is related to the package size. A 500MB package takes about 1 minute.
downloadDisabledTips: Exceeds 10 GB. Please download in batches from the artifact repository.
pipelineConstraintModeTips: In constraint mode, You can't arrange the pipeline freely and should update the instance through template
saveBeforeSwitch: In order to avoid data loss caused by switching failure, please save the draft first
notAllowPatchDeletePacPipelineTips: Automatically created by enabling PAC mode, delete pipeline please go to the code repository operation
clearFilterConditionTips: You can try adjusting keywords or {0}
ymlDeletedTips: The YAML file on the default branch has been deleted. The trigger such as cron/CR/issue/note based on the default branch configuration is invalid. If the pipeline is no longer needed, it can be manually deleted for cleanup
pacModePipelineDeleteTips: PAC mode is enabled, please delete the yaml file on the default branch of the code repository before deleting the pipeline
noStartupParams: No input parameters, no need to fill in
badgeTips: Badge can be added to the README.md of the project to facilitate visitors to quickly understand the construction status, test results or deployment status of the project
tempWithoutConf: Template does not include this setting
noPipelineStageTips: The pipeline has not been configured with stages
triggerLeastOne: At least one trigger is required
branchVersionNotMergeYet: Branch version has not yet been merged into the default branch {0} {1}
branchVersionTips1: 1. When PUSH, MR, TAG events are triggered, the pipeline configuration is based on the corresponding YAML file on the triggered branch
branchVersionTips2: 2. For other triggering methods (CRON, MANUAL, ISSUE, REVIEW, NOTE, etc.), the pipeline configuration is based on the corresponding YAML file on the default branch
branchVersionTips3: 3. The pipeline view page displays the content of the corresponding YAML file on the default branch
versionRuleP: P: Pipeline arrangement version, including Stage, Job, Step, and variables
versionRuleA: Additional bits: Modified version of other information of the pipeline, such as name, description, running settings, etc.
clickToAddStage: Click to add the first pipeline stage
executeStepPreview: Preview of steps to be executed
yamlFilePathErrorTip: File path must end with .yml or .yaml
unSupportCodeMode: Code mode is not supported yet
templateYamlNotSupport: The constrained mode pipeline (template instance) currently does not support Code mode viewing and PAC mode publishing.
pacDesc: Pipeline as Code mode, referred to as PAC mode. After enabling and submitting the pipeline file to the code base, you can maintain the pipeline by maintaining the code base file.

delegation.tips1: The following scenarios will use the proxy holder's permissions:
delegation.tips2: 1. In scenarios such as code repository triggers, scheduled triggers, sub-pipeline triggers, and remote triggers (when no trigger person is specified), the platform will check whether the permission holder has {0}. If not, the trigger will fail.
delegation.tips3: 2. During pipeline execution, the permission holder will be assigned to the built-in variable {0}. Some plugins will use this data to verify whether the corresponding system/functional operation permissions are available.
delegation.tips4: Before authorizing the proxy holder, please clarify the functions and operation scope of the pipeline to avoid unauthorized access.
delegation.tips5: The proxy holder defaults to the pipeline creator; if you need to change it, please have the {0} reset it here.
delegation.resetAuthTips1: After the reset, code repository triggers, scheduled triggers, and sub-pipeline triggers will use {0} to execute the pipeline.
delegation.resetAuthTips2: Please confirm if authorization is possible.

debugHint: Debugging and execution do not share build numbers, but they share concurrency control. Debug records are only valid during the draft version debugging period and will be automatically cleared after the version is released.
templateRollbackBackTips: The current pipeline is in constraint mode (template instance). You need to jump to the template to roll back the version.
constraintFormat: Only Double Curly Braces Supported to Avoid System Assignment Issues in Bash Scripts
traditionalFunctionFormat: Can only be used in the flow control option {0} settings
constraintFunctionFormat: Functions can be used in pipeline configurations such as flow control options, plugin parameters, and Job settings
constraintFunctionFormatExample: If the value of variable 'a' is a JSON string, you can use fromJSON in a bash script to read it, e.g., echo "a.node is ${{fromJSON(a).node}}"
constraintReadOnlyMode: It will cause errors and the run will fail
constraintStandardMode: Chinese IDs Not Supported to Reduce Compatibility Issues in Different Build Environments
versionNotMatch: The current version is not the latest version and cannot be executed

buildNoBaseline.tips1: 1. This configuration sets the baseline value for the build number to increment according to the strategy:
buildNoBaseline.tips2: - When the pipeline runs for the first time, it will start incrementing based on this configuration.
buildNoBaseline.tips3: - After modifying the baseline value and releasing the version, if you want subsequent executions to start incrementing from the new baseline, please perform the 'Reset Current Build Number' operation in the variable view interface to make the changes take effect.
buildNoBaseline.tips4: 2. There are two ways to reference it:
buildNoBaseline.tips5: - In pipeline orchestration, use the context ${{ ci.build-no }}
buildNoBaseline.tips6: - In the script files referenced by the pipeline, use the built-in environment variable ${{BK_CI_BUILD_NO}}
buildNoBaseline.tips7: 3. Example: If the baseline value is 0 and the strategy is to increment by 1 each time, the build number for the next triggered run will be 1.
buildNoBaseline.manualResetRequired: Changes to the baseline value will not take effect automatically. Please make sure to manually reset it after release.
buildNoBaseline.templateManualResetRequired: After modifying the baseline, you can apply it while upgrading the instance, or manually reset the instance build number after the upgrade
buildNoBaseline.resetRequiredTips: A change in the build number baseline value has been detected. Please manually reset the build number.
buildNoBaseline.isSureReset: Are you sure you want to reset the build number?
buildNoBaseline.CONSISTENT: After reset, subsequent builds will be locked to {0}
buildNoBaseline.SUCCESS_BUILD_INCREMENT: After resetting the build number to the baseline value {0}, the next successful build will start counting from {1}
buildNoBaseline.EVERY_BUILD_INCREMENT: After resetting the build number to the baseline value {0}, the next build will start counting from {1}
buildNoBaseline.instanceBuildNo: Immediately reset to baseline value after instantiation
buildNoBaseline.forthcomingReset: Build number has changed, reset is imminent!
buildNoBaseline.forthcomingResetPipeline: The following pipeline build numbers have been detected to change, and will automatically reset after instantiation:
buildNoBaseline.uncheck: If you do not need to reset immediately, you can uncheck "Reset to baseline value immediately after instantiation", and manually reset it on the pipeline view page when needed.

sureDeleteDraft: Are you sure you want to delete this draft?
deleteDraftPipeline: The current pipeline has not been published yet. Deleting the draft is equivalent to deleting the pipeline. Are you sure you want to proceed?
isTaskTermination: Are you sure you want to terminate the task execution?

archive.tips:
Pipeline archiving is irreversible. After archiving:
1. It can only be viewed, editing and execution are not supported
2. It can be manually deleted, if not deleted, it will be automatically cleared after two years
3. Archiving only retains pipeline orchestration and execution history, logs and artifacts are not included
archive.unableToFile: The pipeline is running and cannot be archived
archive.isArchiveConfirmedTitles: Are you sure you want to archive the following {0} pipelines?
archive.isArchiveConfirmedTitle: Are you sure you want to archive the following pipelines?
archive.archiveTips1: After a pipeline is archived, it cannot be edited or executed, and {0}.
archive.archiveTips3: Only users with {0} can view and delete.
archive.archivingTaskRunning: Archiving task is running asynchronously, and the archiving result will be notified upon completion.
archive.deleteOrMoveYamlInRepoIfPacModeEnabled: If the pipeline has PAC mode enabled, please delete/move the YAML file in the repository yourself to avoid automatic re-creation of the corresponding pipeline when the repository is triggered.
archive.onlyDraftVersion: Only draft version, no need to archive, deletion is recommended
archive.unableToArchive: There are {0} pipelines unable to be archived
archive.archiving: Archiving, a notification email will be sent upon completion. Please refresh the list manually.

validVariableFormat: Please enter a valid variable format
pacRepoNotSet: The associated PAC repository will be automatically monitored, no need to set it
groupLabelTips: Variables with the same label will be displayed in the same group in the view and execution preview interface
noArchivedPipelines: No archived pipelines for now, no action needed
notParamsTip: This parameter is no longer an input parameter or has been deleted and cannot be passed during execution. You can manually delete it, or it will be automatically removed from the parameter list after saving.
